page.title: 17The Windmills C.J. School
page.content: This junior school opened in 1967 with about 230 children in eight classes. Before then the infants and juniors went to one school (an old Victorian village school which is now just for infants). The numbers have been as high as 430 children in thirteen classes. Two of these classes had to use rooms in the Downlands secondary school. A new open-plan wing was built in 1971 for three classes. This wing is now divided as one classroom, a library, a music room and a resources area; we use this for computer work and to be near the library for reference. The number of children is now back to about 240 in eight classes. There are now fewer children in Hassocks than ten years ago but the total population is about the same.
